other_tests.findings: 76% blast cells with monocytic features and a complex karyotype including monosomy 7, del(5q), and 2 marker chromosomes.
A novel, heterozygous 3-kilobase deletion removing exons 7-9 of TP53.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The deletion was found to be homozygous in the leukemia DNA as a result of uniparental disomy.

other_tests.findings: 28 validated somatic single-nucleotide variations or indels in coding genes, 8 somatic structural variants, and 12 somatic copy number alterations detected in the leukemia genome.
Except for the deleted region (exons 7-9), TP53 mRNA expression was similar to or higher than that observed in AML without TP53 mutations.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Overall no difference in TP53 target gene expression between patient and control samples.

other_tests.findings: High-level predominantly nuclear staining of TP53 in leukemic blast cells.
Complex chromosomal rearrangements identified including 8 novel chromosomal translocations.
